alert.note: Alert for Dubois (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 24 at 8:36PM EDT until March 26 at 4:17AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Indiana, including the following counties, Dubois, Orange and Washington. * WHEN...Until 230 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 836 PM EDT, local county dispatch reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to repeated rainfall has led to a few typically flood prone locations experiencing minor flooding. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jasper, Paoli, Huntingburg, Ferdinand, Orleans, French Lick, Stampers Creek, Orangeville, Holland and Campbellsburg. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
